Items.Title: Oversight: “The Department of Education’s Monitoring of Students at Closing Schools”
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight: “The Department of Education’s Monitoring of Students at Closing Schools”

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide data regarding student discharges.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to provide data regarding student discharges.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide data regarding students who were transferred to an alternate school as a result of a school closure.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to provide data regarding students who were transferred to an alternate school as a result of a school closure.

Items.Title: Oversight: “The Department of Education’s Monitoring of Students at Closing Schools”
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight: “The Department of Education’s Monitoring of Students at Closing Schools”

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide data regarding student discharges.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide data regarding students who were transferred to an alternate school as a result of a school closure.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to provide data regarding students who were transferred to an alternate school as a result of a school closure.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: James and Seabrook
